meanings.definition: The act of surviving from one growing season to the next.
meanings.sent1: Perennation is crucial for plants to endure changing weather.
meanings.sent2: The perennation of the flowers brought color to the garden every year.
meanings.sent3: The perennation of the cactus made it the true survivor of the desert.
meanings.sent4: Her perennation through tough times inspired others to persevere.
meanings.sent5: The perennation of the oak tree symbolized resilience and strength.

meanings.sent1: The garden's beauty relied on the perennation of its plants.
meanings.sent2: Perennation ensures the flowers return year after year.
meanings.sent3: The perennation of the old tree made it a landmark in the town.
meanings.sent4: His perennation in the community earned him respect and admiration.
meanings.sent5: The perennation of the river flowing through the valley was a constant source of life.

meanings.definition: The process of overwintering in a dormant state.
meanings.sent1: The perennation of the bear in its den kept it safe during winter.
meanings.sent2: Plants use perennation to survive the cold months.
meanings.sent3: The perennation of the squirrel in its cozy nest looked quite peaceful.
meanings.sent4: The perennation of the seeds underground awaited the warmth of spring.
meanings.sent5: The perennation of the caterpillar in its cocoon transformed it into a butterfly.
